subject: Re: How to test private methods in a class.
msgSnippet: ... access, ... you re ... Exactly! And the latter also holds true for using classes from a com.sun package, or from a package that ends in .internal . ...
messageBody:
> Using reflection is ugly and so hard to use compared to direct
access,
> that' it's really not the same thing. Plus if you do it you know
you're
> doing something skanky.

Exactly! And the latter also holds true for using classes from a
com.sun package, or from a package that ends in ".internal".

> I'm not
> sure I approve of it being in the language, but its presence
certainly
> doesn't justify making things public that shouldn't be.

Isn't that begging the question?

Anyway, what I'm disagreeing with is the "shouldn't be" part, I
guess. Making something public doesn't necessarily make it published.

But perhaps we should just agree to disagree at this point?

Cheers, Ilja
